question: A bar magnet, tied in the middle with a thread, was suspended at the North Pole. It would be stable in __:
option1: Vertical position with its south pole downward
option2: Vertical position with its north pole downward
option3: Nearly vertical position with its south pole downward
option4: Nearly vertical position with its north pole downward
answer: Nearly vertical position with its north pole downward
explanation: A bar magnet points north south direction when tied in the middle with a thread because the north pole of the magnet inside it is attracted to the south pole of Earth's built-in magnet and vice versa. As the Earth's magnetic field lines are not parallel to the surface, so it creates nearly vertical position with its north pole downward.
